ParentsDialogue: ^[In front of you are two figures, a man and a woman.]
^[You recognize the man's wide shoulders on top a sturdy back, much like the one you used to climb on as a child.]
^[Amid the woman's hair is a familiar streak of grey, formally hidden behind a layer of dye but now exposed.]
^[You step closer, heart hammering in your chest.]

g-0: ^[The figures, your parents, turn to look at you with wide eyes, mouths agape.]
^[Your father's beard is untrimmed and your mother's hair is unkempt, but everything else is the same as when they left.]
^[You desperately blink away the tears blurring your vision, as if they'll disappear again the second your eyes leaves them.]
^I can't believe it! You look like it's only been a week- I mean, you've been gone so long, I don't...
^[Your words are scrambled and come out in strained, barely-contained sobs.]
^[Your overwhelmed ramblings are only interrupted when your mother throws herself over you, pulling you into a tight hug.]
^[Your father follows, wrapping his arms around the both of you.]
^[The storm of questions swirling through your head quells and dies down, and a welcome silence taking over.]
^[The details don't matter, you tell yourself. Not now.]
^[You bury your head where your parents' shoulders meet and sink into their embrace.]
^[Going home can wait just a little longer.]
